question_text: Which of the following events can lead to complete RAID array failure in multi-drive configurations? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: Failure of two drives in a RAID 5 striping with parity setup
Failure of a single drive in a RAID 0 striping array
Simultaneous rebuild and drive failure in RAID 6 double parity
correct_answer: Failure of two drives in a RAID 5 striping with parity setup
Failure of a single drive in a RAID 0 striping array
Simultaneous rebuild and drive failure in RAID 6 double parity
explanation: RAID 5 cannot tolerate more than one failure. RAID 0 fails if any drive fails. Incorrect rebuilds or additional failures during RAID 6 rebuilds can also lead to array failure.
